bug.author: prabindh
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GradientTape>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GradientTape</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
Class members and Return values in "gradient" function not consistent with actual values in code <denchmark-h:h3>Correct links</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Parameters defined</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Returns defined</denchmark-h>
Needs to be modified gradient () :
Argument - unconnected_gradients: a value which can either hold 'none' or 'zero'
Should be NONE or ZERO
Return values:
In addition to the mentioned return values, If none of the provided elements in "sources" argument are being watched, the function will return None <denchmark-h:h3>Raises listed and defined</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Usage example</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
Yes

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/prabindh>@prabindh</denchmark-link> , It looks like the maintainers are only accepting more-significant Docs PRs, to reduce the overhead of tiny changes. Thanks for taking a shot. Please try again when you have more to contribute.
